page.title: 17Farming
page.content: The farms in the area average 100 acres. The soil is sandy and easily worked. Sugar beet is grown for processing at the Kidderminster factory and grain is sold to local merchants. An increasing trend is to grow fruit and vegetables for sale locally. At one time, these crops were harvested by casual workers and sent to local markets but now they are sold on a 'pick your own' basis to the consumers themselves. People enjoy buying produce in this way as they are cheaper than in the shops, you can select the best and they couldn't be fresher. Many crops are offered including beans, onions, sweetcorn, greens, root crops, strawberries and other soft fruit and apples and pears. Many farms offer facilities for picnics so families can make it a day out in the country.
